mdRecord.dcterms:title: Vapo-Cresolene lamp
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Vapo-Cresolene Company [manufacturer]
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Vaporizing lamp, including stand, movable cup, globe, and wick, with commercial packaging. The Vapo-Cesolene lamp was designed to vaporize chemical substances, such as cresolene, a by-product of coal-tar used as a disinfectant, by suspending the substance in a metal dish over a flame. The device was used to alleviate respiratory symptoms such as cough and asthma. [original]
Photographed by Claude Moore Health Sciences Library, Historical Collections and Services staff. [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Medical instruments and apparatus
